segments.text: I notice the boy precariously balanced on that stool; it looks like it could tip any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How brazen he is, reaching into the cookie jar without a care in the world!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something funny about the situation, but it also makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister stands nearby, watching intently like a little hawk, waiting for her turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at them, to break the spell of this mundane moment turned risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the woman keeps polishing that plate, oblivious to the mischief brewing behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She steps into the spreading puddle, and I wonder if she’ll finally notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window feels ironic against this unfolding chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a piece of me that’s just waiting for the inevitable crash of the stool hitting the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet another part of me just wants to enjoy the absurdity of this family moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
